alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 14 at 12:01PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...LIGHT WINTRY MIX/FREEZING DRIZZLE POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT INTO SATURDAY MORNING... A warm front is expected to move through Southcentral overnight through Saturday morning bringing a light wintry mix/freezing drizzle which may result in a light dusting of snow/light glaze of ice on surfaces. Light precipitation is expected to spread from southeast to northwest just after midnight through the late morning hours Saturday before drying out. Timing is as follows for the light wintry mix/light freezing drizzle: 1) Kenai Peninsula- mainly Ninilchik north including Kenai/Soldotna and the Sterling Highway: Around midnight through 7-8 AM Saturday morning. 2) Anchorage Bowl: Between 3 AM to 8 AM Saturday 3) Matanuska Valley (especially Wasilla westward): Between 3 AM to 8 AM Saturday 4) Susitna Valley- Between 6 AM and 10 AM Saturday Monitor the forecast at www.weather.gov/afc for the latest update.

area.areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula
